p: Five simple phenols ( 161– 167) were detected in the essential oil of Cannabis ( Figure 12) and identified by GC/MS as eugenol ( 161), methyleugenol ( 162), iso-eugenol ( 163), trans-anethol ( 164) and cis-anethol ( 165) [ 3, 83]. Vanillin ( 166) was isolated and identified from hemp pectin using silica gel column chromatography and identified via 1H NMR, 13C NMR, and ESI-MS spectroscopic methods [ 84]. Phloroglucinol β-D-glucoside ( 167) was identified from the stem exudate of greenhouse-grown C. sativa by TLC, but its aglycone (phloroglucinol) was isolated after acid hydrolysis of the exudate. Phloroglucinol was identified by 1H NMR and GC/MS experiments [ 85].
